messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re flylady
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 3/5/03 2:56:24 PM, starsuncloud@cs.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 3/5/03 2:56:24 PM, starsuncloud@... writes:

<< I'll pick up a shoe in the living room, it reminds me that the
entry way is messy, I pick up a bag in the entry way, notice that the desk
has a bunch of papers, start in on those...sigh.
It's like a big circular thing. I always end up back at the beginning
eventually. >>

Ritalin.

There are drugs to keep you from being distracted.

There is a drug to make you think taking that show and putting it away was
just good enough. A real accomplishment.

Sandra
(who does that same going along until coming to something else interesting
thing)

messages.subject: Re flylady
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 3/5/03 3:23:09 PM Central Standard Time, Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 3/5/03 3:23:09 PM Central Standard Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:

<< I'm distractable and very very very easily sidetracked. Then I regret
it later. >>

ME TOO! I think I like you even better now....
I've finally decided that the part of me that is very easily distracted
another good thing about being a creative, daydreamer kind of gal.
Instead of berating myself over it, I have accepted and embraced this part of
myself.
I even get a good laugh sometimes, because as I clean, I never finish ONE
whole thing. I'll pick up a shoe in the living room, it reminds me that the
entry way is messy, I pick up a bag in the entry way, notice that the desk
has a bunch of papers, start in on those...sigh.
It's like a big circular thing. I always end up back at the beginning
eventually.

I like our five minute clean ups best. The kids and I tackle the living room,
kitchen and dining room for exactly five minutes each. I seem to get the most
done in a short time and feel better the rest of the day.

Ren
"The sun is shining--the sun is shining. That is the magic. The flowers are
growing--the roots are stirring. That is the magic. Being alive is the
magic--being strong is the magic The magic is in me--the magic is in
me....It's in every one of us."

----Frances Hodgson Burnett
